div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 1138 Olbia (mod. Parutino), Ochakov raion, Nikolaev oblast, Ukraine, 1947 Burial: early 1st cent. B.C. ? (Karyszkowski) Contents: 13 AE. On the floor of one room in agora Olbia: 11 AE (as AMNG I.1, pl. 9, 8 [2], 10-11 [6], 13 [1], 23 [1]; pl. 10, 2 [1]) Istrus: 1 AE (as AMNG I.1, pl. 8, 7) Unc. Pontus-Paphlagonia: 1 AE (Ares and sword) Disposition: Kiev Kharko, "Ol'viia," pp. 355-7, nos. 358-63 (with omissions) All coins except the last listed are of late 4th-early 3rd cent. B.C.
